name: A. Pasha and Stick
statement:
Pasha has a wooden stick of some positive integer length . He wants to
perform exactly three cuts to get four parts of the stick. Each part
must have some positive integer length and the sum of these lengths will
obviously be . Pasha likes rectangles but hates squares, so he wonders,
how many ways are there to split a stick into four parts so that it’s
possible to form a rectangle using these parts, but is impossible to
form a square.Your task is to help Pasha and count the number of such
ways. Two ways to cut the stick are considered distinct if there exists
some integer , such that the number of parts of length in the first way
differ from the number of parts of length in the second way.
